snippet: Syncora Guarantee, a bond insurer, had brought the legal action over toxic mortgage-backed securities at the center of the 2008 financial crisis.
abstract: Bank of America agrees to pay $375 million to settle a lawsuit brought by Syncora Guarantee over toxic mortgage-backed securities at the center of the 2008 financial crisis; Syncora sued Bank of America to recover losses on securities transactions made by Countrywide Financial, which Bank of America bought in 2008.
lead_paragraph: Syncora Guarantee, a bond insurer, had brought the legal action over toxic mortgage-backed securities at the center of the 2008 financial crisis.

headline.seo: Bank of America Settles Suit for $375 Million
headline.main: Bank of America Settles Suit for $375 Million
headline.print_headline: Bank of America Settles Suit for $375 Million
